title: Roblox.com domain name reserved
details: The roblox.com domain name was first reserved at this point.

title: Santa's Winter Stronghold Released
details: First holiday place created by Roblox.

title: Roblox Badges released
details: Badges were given out for friendships, knockouts, wipeouts, and other criteria.

title: Place copylocked feature enabled
details: Previously the source files of all places were public by default.

title: Places can be copylocked
details: Previously all games were open by default.

title: Character customization added
details: Users could customize their body colors and add custom t-shirts.

title: Super Safe Chat introduced
details: Allowed <13 users to use specific phrases from a drop-down menu instead of freely chatting.

title: Custom skyboxes and time of day released
Builders Club beta launches
details: Early version of Builders Club released. Initial featureset came with 5 places and no ads.

title: Place Page launched
details: Before this, places did not have their own page.

title: Multiple Place Instances added
details: Before this, all players were placed into a single game instance with no max player count.

title: SpawnLocation object added
details: Allowed developers to customize where users spawn on the map.

title: Robux introduced
details: Replaced 'Roblox Points' as the primary currency of Roblox. Robux could be earned through the login bonus or place visits.

title: Hats introduced
details: Virtual hats introduced that could be purchased in the Roblox catalog for Robux.

title: Roblox moves to new office building
Users can create and sell shirts
details: Initially this required Builders Club.

title: IP Ban feature enabled
details: Allowed Roblox moderators to ban users by IP address.

title: 40,000th user joins
details: StickArena became the 40,000th account to join Roblox.

title: Builders Club released
details: Builders Club feature released to the general public. Users can purchase monthly or yearly subscriptions.

title: Tickets released
details: Tickets were introduced as a secondary currency to Robux. They can be earned by logging in daily, place visits, or item purchases.

title: 50,000th user joins
details: StickArena became the 40,000th account to join Roblox.

title: 5 concurrent players in-game
details: David Baszucki emailed the team 'On server duty today – 5 people in-game, a new record!'

title: New graphics engine released
details: This release included explosions and switched the graphics to Direct3D

title: Parents Section added
details: Added a Parent's section to the Roblox website

title: Bevels added to parts
details: Bevels were rounded edges added to the corners of parts to give them more of a 3D feel.

title: Comments introduced
details: Comments feature added for hats and shirts.

title: Catalog Search added
details: Previously the catalog did not have a search feature.

title: Real-Life Merchandise Shop
details: Roblox launched a CafePress shop with shirts, hats, pins, and other real-life merchandise.

title: Gifts introduced
details: Virtual gifts were given out during December that later become exclusive catalog items.

title: Image Review Process
details: From the blog: 'New image review scheme. User uploaded images don’t display anywhere on the site or in-game until moderated by a real human being.'

title: DHTML Window removed
details: An in-game embedded browseer that could be accessed via Lua was removed.

title: PayPal supported as payment provider
details: Builders Club memberships could be purchased for the first time using PayPal.

title: First official Roblox Egg Hunt
details: Egg Hunt launched where users can collect eggs which show up in their inventory.

title: Place Comments
details: The comments feature existed previously, but only worked for catalog items like shirts and hats.

title: Shirts and Pants released
details: Full-body shirts and pants were released on Roblox. The feature previously known as 'shirts' was rebranded as t-shirts'

title: Favorites feature launched
details: Places and other asset types can be marked as faVorites, and show up in your favorites section on the Profile page.

title: User-uploadable decals introduced
details: This allowed users to add 2D textures to their games. This was possible before, but the images only showed up in play solo.

title: Guest Mode added
details: Guest Mode allowed users to play Roblox games before you signed up for an account. From the blog: 'Guest mode players appear in-game with the name "Guest ####". They’re just like normal users, except they can only use Super Safe chat and their stats don’t get logged from game to game.'

title: Buy Robux feature launched
details: Previously, users only received Robux by purchasing Builders Club and receiving a daily stipend. The Buy Robux feature allowed users to purchase Robux directly from Roblox.

title: Currency Exchange launched
details: The currency exchange feature allowed users to trade between Robux and Tickets. The exchange worked the same way as a real-life exchange, with dynamic rates and a spread dictated by demand.

title: User Ads introduced
details: Allowed users to run website ads to draw traffic to their places, models, decals, clothing, etc. The number of times the ad is shown is based on the user's bid amount.

title: Heads added to the catalog
details: This release allowed people to select heads for their character, instead of using the default head.

title: Faces added to the catalog
details: This release allowed people to customize their character by selecting a custom face. At the time of launch there were 20 faces in the catalog.

title: Wood material released
details: This release allowed developers to use a wood grain on their parts, not just plastic.

title: Recommendations added for catalog items
details: From the blog: 'Also new in this release is the asset recommender. When you are looking at a places, hats, shirts, heads, faces, etc we now present you with a random selection of other stuff that we think you might like.'

title: In-game color palette expanded
details: In the early days Roblox only allowed you to use a small set of colors. In this release that list was expanded from 32 to 64 brick colors, with a focus on saturated colors.

title: Ambassador Program launched
details: The ambassador program allowed users to drop HTML snippets on other websites to advertise Roblox. Signups attributed to those links would earn Tickets for the link owner.

title: Slate material added
details: The Slate material is a rough, rocky looking material that complemented the existing wood and plastic materials.

title: Vehicle Seats released
details: Vehicle Seats are a newer version of seats that automatically drive the motion of vehicles using hinge joints.

title: Gear added to the catalog
details: Gear is a new asset type that represented in-game tools and items. The first gear released was Brigand's Sword, which dealt damage when used in-game.

title: Rental gear supported in catalog
details: Rental catalog items expired after a specific timespan and could no longer be used.

title: Turbo Builders Club released
details: Turbo Builders Club was an additional tier of Builders Club with a higher price point. It included features like additional places, higher 35 Robux daily stipend, and an exclusive Turbo Builders Club hard hat.

title: Best Friends feature released
details: This release allowed people to choose up to 10 'best friends' who showed up in the 'My Roblox' page and in a personalized feed.

title: Status feature introduced
details: The status feature allowed users to post a short message to let their friends know what they were up to.

title: Groups feature released
details: Groups are a social feature that allowed people to form their own communities. Initially groups could only be created by users with Builders Club or Turbo Builders Club.

title: Player Badges released
details: With this release, developers were able to create their own badges that could be awarded in-game for meeting certain criteria.

title: Group Search page added
details: This allowed people to discover groups more easily, not just on the profile pages of other users.

title: Group Status feature introduced
details: Similar to the existing Status feature for players, this allowed group administrators to post status updates for the group that would appear on the feed of group members.

title: Web Chat released
details: Added a basic live chat feature to the Roblox website, where you could chat with your friends. This version of chat did not save messages beyond a few days.

title: More materials added
details: Additional materials added including Concrete, Corroded Metal, Diamond Plate, Aluminum, and Ice.

title: Lua GUI System launched
details: Roblox added a few basic GUI elements as in-game objects: Frame, Label, Button, SelectionBox, and Handles, with the goal of empowering developers to create and script their own Graphical User Interfaces.

title: Building with Friends feature enabled
details: Allowed group owners to set up a 'group building place' that members could work on collaboratively in a multiplayer environment.

title: Limited and Limited Unique items released
details: Limited and Limited Unique items were originally sold by Roblox, but could be re-sold by the purchasers to other users in the virtual marketplace.

title: Refer-a-friend Program launched
details: The referral code program allowed users to share a code with friends. If friends used the code and later signed up for Builders Club, the person who referred them would get bonus Robux deposited in their account.

title: Customizable Group Ranks supported
details: Initially, the list of group ranks was hardcoded to Member, Admin, and Owner. This update allowed users to customize and create new group ranks with their own names, descriptions, and powers.

title: Configuration Building Tool added
details: The Configuration tool was a no-code mechanism to allow players to customize a few preset attributes of models without needing to dive into Lua or Roblox Studio.

title: Website Themes released
details: Allowed users to choose between a few themes to customize the look of the website. The launch included Classic, Test theme, and the OBC theme.

title: Bubble Chat introduced
details: Optional in-game feature where chat messages display in white bubbles above characters.

title: Particle effects improved
details: A new Smoke particle effect is added and the existing Sparkles effect is enhanced. Smoke is notably the first particle effect with granular customization, such as opacity, rise velocity, and size.

title: Sets added
details: Sets allowed users to group content by adding them to lists. It was intended to be used primarily for building assets like models and decals.

title: Roblox runs first donation effort 'Hats for Haiti'
details: This was noteworthy as the first time Roblox ran a crowdsourced donation drive for charity. The proceeds were donated to the American Red Cross to help with earthquake relief efforts for the 2010 Haiti Earthquake.

title: Contests feature launched
details: The Contests feature gamified the contest experience by having users submit places to be voted on by their peers. Prizes were automatically given out to users who voted closest to their peers, or who received the most votes on their submissions.

title: New Body Shapes revealed
details: Roblox added new catalog item types for Arms, Legs, and Torsos to allow users to further customize their characters.

title: Wearing Triple Hats supported
details: This update allowed users to wear three hats at once. Prior to this change, users were only able to achieve this with the infinite hat glitch.
